result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl H Wilkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $220.00 payable to the victim Samuel N.

Pay applicable court costs, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC will collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

***August 29, 2014/Judge M.Joseph Donald/JOC corrected to state that the term of initial confinement is 18 months.  All other sentencing orders shall remain in effect.***                          
***11-14-14, Judge Donald, The defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.***

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victim Samuel N.
Comply with the standard rules of Extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl H Wilkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amending Judgment of Conviction; signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify eligibility for challenge incarceration and substance abuse programs.
Correcting Judgment of Conviction; signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify written JOC.

Defendant Carl H Wilkins in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Statements made by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements by defendant's uncle, Waymon S. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to the Wisconsin State Prison for a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS, with credit for 92 DAYS time served.  Court ordered 18 MONTHS for the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT and 24 MONTHS of EXTENDED SUPERVISION with the following conditions:

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim, Samuel N.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $220.00 payable to the victim, Samuel N.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
(2) Letters to Judge Donald; from the defendant.

Defendant Carl H Wilkins in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form.
with attached Restitution Worksheet filed by ADA Timothy Cotter on behalf of the State.

Attorney Daryl A. Kastenson in court, defendant Carl H Wilkins not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today, however, the parties are not ready to proceed.
Parties still under negotiations.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-28-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Carl H Wilkins not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke for Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
The ADA of record, Timothy Cotter, is currently out on medical leave.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-17-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Carl H Wilkins not in court, in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Carl H Wilkins in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Carl H Wilkins in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Samuel N. as well as Trinity Irish Pub or any employee of theirs.

Defendant Carl H Wilkins in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Carl H Wilkins in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
